issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
Pull to Refresh fails to update table with new rows after pull down. 

This is a regression bug. It doesn't exist on 2.0.2.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run KitchenSink
2. Base UI- Views- Table Views- Pull to Refresh
3. Press and pull down

Expected Result:
Table should be updated with more rows each time a pull down is done to refresh

Actual Result:
Table is not being updated with new rows after pull down
fields.summary: iOS: Table Views - Pull to Refresh fails to add more rows
fields.environment:
Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.0.201206062004
Titanium SDK: 2.1.0.v20120607120249
Device: iPad 3(5.1.1)

comments.body: Can not reproduce on latest master. QE is almost certainly running the old KS project. Look at TIMOB-8077 to see the change in the KS project and the new events defined for tableviews

Tested on and failed:
Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.2.201208201549
Devices:
iPhone 4 version 4.3.5
iPad 3 version 5.1.
iPhone 4S version 6 beta 4
